intro: Diphryllum eschscholtzianum, commonly known as the umbrella plant, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its distinctive umbrella-like cluster of leaves at the top of its stems, which gives it its common name. The plant has simple, opposite, and often leathery leaves that are usually dark green in color. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellowish in hue. The plant is adapted to humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal or lowland forest areas.
